refsynopsisdiv.title: Synopsis

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: A set of GP11Attribute structures. These attributes contain information about a PKCS11 object. Use gp11_object_get() or gp11_object_set() to set and retrieve attributes on an object.

refsect2.title: GP11Attributes
refsect2.para: A set of GP11Attribute structures.

refsect2.title: gp11_attributes_new ()
refsect2.para: Create a new GP11Attributes array.

listitem.simpara: The new attributes array. When done with the array release it with gp11_attributes_unref().

refsect2.title: gp11_attributes_new_empty ()
refsect2.para: Creates an GP11Attributes array with empty attributes. The arguments should be values of attribute types, terminated with -1.

listitem.simpara: The first attribute type to add as empty.
The new attributes array. When done with the array release it with gp11_attributes_unref().

refsect2.title: gp11_attributes_newv ()
refsect2.para: Create a new GP11Attributes array.
The arguments must be triples of: attribute type, data type, value

para.para:
The variable argument list should contain:
a)
The gulong attribute type (ie: CKA_LABEL).
b)
The attribute data type (one of GP11_BOOLEAN, GP11_ULONG, GP11_STRING, GP11_DATE) orthe raw attribute value length.
c)
The attribute value, either a gboolean, gulong, gchar*, GDate* or a pointer to a raw attribute value.
The variable argument list should be terminated with GP11_INVALID.

listitem.simpara: The new attributes array. When done with the array release it with gp11_attributes_unref().

refsect2.title: gp11_attributes_at ()
refsect2.para: Get attribute at the specified index in the attribute array.
Use gp11_attributes_count() to determine how many attributes are in the array.

listitem.simpara: The attributes array.
The attribute index to retrieve.
The specified attribute.

refsect2.title: gp11_attributes_add ()
refsect2.para: Add the specified attribute to the array.
The value stored in the attribute will be copied.

listitem.simpara: The attributes array to add to
The attribute to add.

refsect2.title: gp11_attributes_add_data ()
refsect2.programlisting: void gp11_attributes_add_data (GP11Attributes *attrs, gulong attr_type, gconstpointer value, gsize length);
refsect2.para: Add an attribute with the specified type and value to the array.
The value stored in the attribute will be copied.

listitem.simpara: The attributes array to add to.
The type of attribute to add.
The raw memory of the attribute value.
The length of the attribute value.

refsect2.title: gp11_attributes_add_invalid ()
refsect2.para: Add an attribute with the specified type and an 'invalid' value to the array.

listitem.simpara: The attributes array to add to.
The type of attribute to add.

refsect2.title: gp11_attributes_add_empty ()
refsect2.para: Add an attribute with the specified type, with empty data.

listitem.simpara: The attributes array to add.
The type of attribute to add.

refsect2.title: gp11_attributes_add_boolean ()
refsect2.para: Add an attribute with the specified type and value to the array.
The value will be stored as a CK_BBOOL PKCS11 style attribute.

listitem.simpara: The attributes array to add to.
The type of attribute to add.
The boolean value to add.

refsect2.title: gp11_attributes_add_string ()
refsect2.para: Add an attribute with the specified type and value to the array.
The value will be copied into the attribute.

listitem.simpara: The attributes array to add to.
The type of attribute to add.

refsect2.title: gp11_attributes_add_date ()
refsect2.para: Add an attribute with the specified type and value to the array.
The value will be stored as a CK_DATE PKCS11 style attribute.

listitem.simpara: The attributes array to add to.
The type of attribute to add.

refsect2.title: gp11_attributes_add_ulong ()
refsect2.para: Add an attribute with the specified type and value to the array.
The value will be stored as a CK_ULONG PKCS11 style attribute.

listitem.simpara: The attributes array to add to.
The type of attribute to add.
The gulong value to add.

refsect2.title: gp11_attributes_find ()
refsect2.para: Find an attribute with the specified type in the array.

listitem.simpara: The attributes array to search.
The type of attribute to find.
The first attribute found with the specified type, or NULL.

refsect2.title: gp11_attributes_find_boolean ()
refsect2.para: Find an attribute with the specified type in the array.
The attribute (if found) must be of the right size to store a boolean value (ie: CK_BBOOL). If the attribute is marked invalid then it will be treated as not found.

listitem.simpara: The attributes array to search.
The type of attribute to find.
The resulting gboolean value.
Whether a value was found or not.

refsect2.title: gp11_attributes_find_ulong ()
refsect2.para: Find an attribute with the specified type in the array.
The attribute (if found) must be of the right size to store a unsigned long value (ie: CK_ULONG). If the attribute is marked invalid then it will be treated as not found.

listitem.simpara: The attributes array to search.
The type of attribute to find.
The resulting gulong value.
Whether a value was found or not.

refsect2.title: gp11_attributes_find_string ()
refsect2.para: Find an attribute with the specified type in the array.
If the attribute is marked invalid then it will be treated as not found. The resulting string will be null-terminated, and must be freed by the caller using g_free().

listitem.simpara: The attributes array to search.
The type of attribute to find.
The resulting string value.
Whether a value was found or not.

refsect2.title: gp11_attributes_find_date ()
refsect2.para: Find an attribute with the specified type in the array.
The attribute (if found) must be of the right size to store a date value (ie: CK_DATE). If the attribute is marked invalid then it will be treated as not found.

listitem.simpara: The attributes array to search.
The type of attribute to find.
The resulting GDate value.
Whether a value was found or not.

refsect2.title: gp11_attributes_count ()
refsect2.para: Get the number of attributes in this attribute array.

listitem.simpara: The attributes array to count.
The number of contained attributes.

refsect2.title: gp11_attributes_ref ()
refsect2.para: Reference this attributes array.

listitem.simpara: An attribute array

refsect2.title: gp11_attributes_unref ()
refsect2.para: Unreference this attribute array.
When all outstanding references are NULL, the array will be freed.

listitem.simpara: An attribute array

refsect2.title: GP11Allocator ()
refsect2.para: An allocator used to allocate data for the attributes in this GP11Attributes set.
This is a function that acts like g_realloc. Specifically it frees when length is set to zero, it allocates when data is set to NULL, and it reallocates when both are valid.

listitem.simpara: Memory to allocate or deallocate.
New length of memory.
